item.title: The 3 Modes of Threat Hunting
item.description: PREFACE This is a short article covering a single foundational concept related to threat hunting. I’m publishing it here as a stand-alone post because I would like to reference it in some of my courses without needing to reproduce it in every such instance. Nevertheless, I hope, even here by itself, it might provide some value to you. INTRODUCTION Threat hunting, by its literal definition, is predicated on a single presumption: we presume a compromise has already occurred, and thus an adversary is established on our network.
